SEARCH
Package com.dua3.utility.ui

Interface Graphics

All Superinterfaces:
AutoCloseable
All Known Implementing Classes:
FxGraphics, SwingGraphics
public interface Graphics extends AutoCloseable
A generic interface defining drawing commands.

The Graphics interface provides an abstraction from the underlying rendering toolkit.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Interface
    Description
    static enum 
    Graphics.HAnchor
    Enum representing horizontal anchor points for aligning text or graphics elements relative to a reference point.
    static enum 
    Graphics.TextRotationMode
    Enum defining the supported text rotation modes.
    static enum 
    Graphics.TextWrapping
    Enum defining the different text wrapping modes.
    static enum 
    Graphics.VAnchor
    Enum representing vertical anchor points for aligning text or graphics elements relative to a reference point.

      Draws the specified image at the given coordinates.
      Parameters:

      default void strokePolyLines(Vector2f... vertices)
      Draws a series of connected lines, forming a polyline, between the given vertices.
      Parameters:

    • strokeEllipse

      void strokeEllipse(float x, float y, float rx, float ry, float angle)
      Draws the outline of an ellipse on the canvas with the specified center coordinates and radii.
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate of the center of the ellipse.
      y - The y-coordinate of the center of the ellipse.
      rx - The horizontal radius (semi-major axis) of the ellipse.
      ry - The vertical radius (semi-minor axis) of the ellipse.
      angle - The rotation angle.

      Parameters:
      x1 - the x-coordinate of the starting point
      y1 - the y-coordinate of the starting point
      x2 - the x-coordinate of the ending point
      y2 - the y-coordinate of the ending point

      Intersects the clip area with the specified rectangle.
      Parameters:
      r - the rectangle to intersect the clip area with

    • resetClip

      void resetClip()
      Resets the clipping area to the default state. This method clears any existing clipping boundaries that might have been set previously and restores the clip to encompass the entire drawing area.

    • setStroke

      void setStroke(Color c, float width)
      Sets the stroke for drawing shapes. The stroke determines the color and width of the lines used to outline shapes.
      Parameters:
      c - the color of the stroke
      width - the width of the stroke, in pixels

    • setStrokeColor

      void setStrokeColor(Color c)
      Sets the stroke color for drawing operations.
      Parameters:
      c - the color to be used for the stroke; must not be null

    • setStrokeWidth

      void setStrokeWidth(float width)
      Sets the width for the stroke to be applied in drawing operations.
      Parameters:
      width - The stroke width to set, specified as a float value. It must be a positive number representing the desired thickness of the stroke.

      the current stroke color as a Color object.

      Parameters:
      t - the affine transformation to set

    • transform

      default AffineTransformation2f transform(AffineTransformation2f... t)
      Apply the given transformations to this Graphics instance.

      These two are equivalent: 

       
     AffineTransformation2f t = g.transform(t1, t2);
      and 
       
     AffineTransformation2f t = g.getTransformation();
     setTransformation(AffineTransformation2f.combine(t1, t2, t);
      Parameters:
      t - the transformation to add
      Returns:
      the transformation that was active before updating

    • setFont

      void setFont(Font f)
      Sets the font used for text rendering.
      Parameters:
      f - the font to set

    • getFont

      Font getFont()
      Get the current font.
      Returns:
      the current font

    • drawText

      void drawText(CharSequence text, float x, float y)
      Draws the specified text at the given coordinates.

      This is equivalent to calling drawText(text, x, y, HAnchor.LEFT, VAnchor.BASELINE)

      Parameters:
      text - the text to be drawn
      x - the x-coordinate of the starting point
      y - the y-coordinate of the starting point

    • drawText

      default void drawText(CharSequence text, Vector2f p)
      Draws the specified text at the given position.
      Parameters:
      text - the text to be drawn
      p - the starting point

    • transform

      default Vector2f transform(Vector2f p)
      Calculates the transformation of a point.

      The transforms a point given in local coordinates to user coordinates.

      Parameters:
      p - the point to transform
      Returns:
      the point transformed to local coordinates as described above

    • transform

      default Vector2f transform(float x, float y)
      Calculates the transformation of a point.

      The transforms a point given in local coordinates to user coordinates.

      Parameters:
      x - the x-coordinate of the point
      y - the x-coordinate of the point
      Returns:
      the point transformed to local coordinates as described above

    • inverseTransform

      default Vector2f inverseTransform(Vector2f p)
      Calculates the inverse transformation of a point.

      The method applies the inverse transformation to convert a point in user coordinates back to local coordinates. In the resulting local space, (0, 0) represents the top-left corner of the output area, and the coordinates are measured in device units (e.g., pixels).

      Parameters:
      p - the point to transform, specified in user coordinates
      Returns:
      the point transformed to local coordinates as described above

    • inverseTransform

      default Vector2f inverseTransform(float x, float y)
      Calculates the inverse transformation of a point.

      The method applies the inverse transformation to convert a point in user coordinates back to local coordinates. In the resulting local space, (0, 0) represents the top-left corner of the output area, and the coordinates are measured in device units (e.g., pixels).

      Parameters:
      x - the x-coordinate of the point, specified in user coordinates
      y - the x-coordinate of the point, specified in user coordinates
      Returns:
      the point transformed to local coordinates as described above

    • getInverseTransformation

      default AffineTransformation2f getInverseTransformation()
      Get the inverse transformation for this Graphics instance.
      Returns:
      the inverse of the current transformation

    • drawText

      default void drawText(CharSequence text, float x, float y, Graphics.HAnchor hAnchor, Graphics.VAnchor vAnchor)
      Draw text at the specified coordinates with the given horizontal and vertical anchor.
      Parameters:
      text - the text to be drawn
      x - the x-coordinate of the starting position for the text
      y - the y-coordinate of the starting position for the text
      hAnchor - the horizontal anchor for the text position (LEFT, RIGHT, or CENTER)
      vAnchor - the vertical anchor for the text position (TOP, BOTTOM, BASELINE, or MIDDLE)

    • getTransformation

      AffineTransformation2f getTransformation()
      Retrieves the affine transformation of the graphics object.
      Returns:
      the affine transformation of the graphics object

    • renderText

      default void renderText(Vector2f pos, RichText text, Graphics.HAnchor hAnchor, Graphics.VAnchor vAnchor, Alignment hAlign, VerticalAlignment vAlign, Dimension2f outputDimension, Graphics.TextWrapping wrapText)
      Renders the given text at the specified position with alignment, anchoring, and wrapping options.
      Parameters:
      pos - the position where the text should be rendered, represented as a 2D vector
      text - the rich text object containing the text and its formatting details
      hAnchor - the horizontal anchoring reference for positioning the text
      vAnchor - the vertical anchoring reference for positioning the text
      hAlign - the horizontal alignment of the text within its bounds
      vAlign - the vertical alignment of the text within its bounds
      outputDimension - the dimension representing the maximum width and height available for rendering
      wrapText - the text wrapping mode, which determines how the text should wrap within the available width

    • renderText

      default void renderText(Vector2f pos, RichText text, Graphics.HAnchor hAnchor, Graphics.VAnchor vAnchor, Alignment hAlign, VerticalAlignment vAlign, Dimension2f outputDimension, Graphics.TextWrapping wrapText, double angle, Graphics.TextRotationMode mode)
      Renders the given text within the specified bounding rectangle using the provided font, alignment, wrapping, and rotation settings.
      Parameters:
      pos - the position
      text - the text to be rendered
      hAnchor - the horizontal anchor setting
      vAnchor - the vertical anchor setting
      hAlign - the horizontal alignment of the text within the bounding rectangle
      vAlign - the vertical alignment of the text within the bounding rectangle
      outputDimension - the dimension of the output area
      wrapText - true, to apply automatic text wrapping
      angle - the rotation angle in radians
      mode - the Graphics.TextRotationMode to use

    • close

      void close()
      Specified by:
      close in interface AutoCloseable

    • approximateArc

      static void approximateArc(Arc2f arc, Consumer<Vector2f> moveTo, Consumer<Vector2f[]> generateBezierSegment)
      Approximates an elliptical arc using Bézier curves and processes each segment using the provided consumer function.
      Parameters:
      arc - the Arc2f object representing the elliptical arc to approximate, containing the arc's start point, end point, radii, rotation angle, and flags indicating large arc or sweep direction.
      moveTo - a Consumer<Vector2f> that processes the starting point of the arc.
      generateBezierSegment - a Consumer<Vector2f[]> that processes the generated Bézier segment points for each subdivided portion of the arc.

    • approximateArc

      static void approximateArc(Vector2f p0, Vector2f p1, Vector2f r, float angle, boolean largeArc, boolean sweep, Consumer<Vector2f> moveTo, Consumer<Vector2f[]> generateBezierSegment)
      Approximates an elliptical arc using Bézier curves. This method converts the arc parameters into one or more quadratic Bézier curves that closely match the arc.
      Parameters:
      p0 - the starting point of the arc
      p1 - the ending point of the arc
      r - the radii of the ellipse (x-axis and y-axis radii)
      angle - the rotation of the ellipse in radians
      largeArc - a boolean indicating whether to draw the larger arc segment
      sweep - a boolean indicating the direction of the arc sweep (clockwise or counter-clockwise)
      moveTo - a consumer to handle the initial move-to operation for the starting point
      generateBezierSegment - a consumer to process the generated Bézier segments for the arc
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the parameters do not define a valid arc (e.g., the distance between points is too great for the provided radii or arc degenerates to a line)
